intro: Piptomeris compressa, commonly known as the smooth thimbleweed, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its leaves are alternate, lance-shaped, and have a smooth texture, while its flowers are small and clustered in a spherical shape. Piptomeris compressa is often used in ecological restoration projects due to its ability to stabilize soil and support local wildlife.
